info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 1:49PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Avery and northern Burke Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 149 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southeast of Newland, or near Crossnore, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newland, Banner Elk, Crossnore, Sugar Mountain, Seven Devils, Grandfather Mountain State Park, B.R. Parkway-Linville Falls To Grandfather, Beech Mountain In Avery County, Altamont and Pineola. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
